title: The Saltwater Heirs
premise: When the last living matriarch of the once-powerful Havelock family, a clan of New England whalers, is diagnosed with a rare condition that causes her to taste the memories of her ancestors in seawater, she must confront the brutal, hidden history of her family's fortune. As she drinks from a hidden cache of century-old sea water, each vial reveals a different ancestor's secret—a murder, a betrayal, a stolen love—forcing her to choose between preserving the family's legacy or dismantling it to free future generations from its toxic inheritance.
protagonist: Elara Havelock, a 68-year-old retired marine biologist and the reluctant keeper of the family's archives.
conflict: Elara's internal struggle to reconcile the horrific truths she uncovers with her love for her living family, while external pressure mounts from relatives who want to monetize their storied past, threatening to bury the secrets she feels morally compelled to expose.
setting: Present-day coastal Maine, with memory sequences spanning from the 1790s Golden Age of Sail to the 1970s collapse of the whaling industry.
tone: Atmospheric, haunting, and introspective, blending the melancholy of the sea with the sharp clarity of uncovered truth.
